summary: The Nasdaq Composite is higher by 6.6% this week, trailed by the S&P 500, ahead 4.5%, and the Dow, up 2.6%. The 10-year Treasury yield slipped more than 8 basis points to 4.44%, while the rate on the 2-year note slid 9 basis points to 3.96%. Retail sales increased 0.1% in April, which matched consensus estimates, while industrial production numbers for April decreased slightly more than expected. Economists polled by Dow Jones forecast PPI would increase 0.3% on the month.
